description.narrative: Programmet syftar till att få valda departement och statliga institutioner att leverera policies, ramverk och service med utgångspunkt i de mänskliga rättigheterna till 2015. Detta ska uppnås genom bla att arbeta in de ratificerade instrumenten för mänskliga rättigheter i det nya utkastet på konstitution, förbättrat ledarskap inom regering & offentlig service, media & civila samhället, lagstift

The programme aims to make targeted Government institutions provide human rights based policies, frameworks and services by 2015. The GRZ-UNDP proposes to achieve this through e.g. a new draft constitution that reflects the ratified international human rights instruments, improved leadership skills in civil service, media & CSOs, improved legislation on access to information and media freedom

description.narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2016Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: The program contributed to building systems and capacities of the three arms of government to improve separation of powers and promote human rights. The Parliament was supported to develop a strategic plan and training of Parliamentarians and staff in RBM, performance management for the legislature and the role of Parliament in governance. To improve gender equality in Parliament, the program supported the institutionalisation of the Parliamentary Women's Caucus which is now recognised by Parliament, has its own professional staff and strategic plan for the first time. Some of the objectives of the caucus is to increase the number of female Parliamentarians and support legislation to promote gender equality in Zambia.
Cabinet office's policy coordination role and transformative leadership improved. Permanent Secretaries from each Ministry and Province were trained and are certified in International Balanced Scorecard which government has adopted in measuring performance leading to improved planning.
The Human Rights Commission(HRC) improved the production of the annual state of human rights report both in terms of quality and timely production of the report. The annual human rights report is the main instrument used by the commission to promote, protect and prevent human rights abuses. In addition, the HRC in collaboration with the Zambia Law Development Commission developed a draft Bill on Criminalising Torture in Zambia in 2016. Zambia had no laws which specifically deal with torture as an offence, where perpetrators of torture are arrested, they are prosecuted under relatively minor offences like assault. This bill intends to provide for: the criminalization of acts of torture and other Cruel, Inhuman or Degrading Treatment or Punishment; the protection of victims of torture; the compensation, rehabilitation, restitution of victims of torture; establishment of the Anti-Torture Fund.
In order to increased effective participation in the stated governance processes, the program undertook extensive civic education focusing on economic social and cultural rights as well as negotiating skills for citizens through area development committees implemented by JCTR.
